snippet: Robert S. Mueller III said that the league had not seen the video of Mr. Rice punching his fiancée before it was made public, but that it did not seek additional information aggressively.
abstract: Former Federal Bureau of Investigation Dir Robert S Mueller III says National Football League knew about circumstances of domestic abuse case involving former Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice, but did not vigorously seek more information; reports NFL and Commissioner Roger Goodell did not have or see video showing Rice punching his fiancee Janay Palmer in elevator before it was made public, but still had cause for concern.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and STEVE EDER

lead_paragraph: Robert S. Mueller III said that the league had not seen the video of Mr. Rice punching his fiancée before it was made public, but that it did not seek additional information aggressively.

headline.main: In Ray Rice Case, N.F.L. Chose Not to Ask Many Questions
headline.print_headline: In Rice Case, N.F.L. Chose Not to Ask Many Questions
